byline.original: By RANDAL C. ARCHIBOLD, DAMIEN CAVE and ELISABETH MALKIN

abstract: Mexico's President Felipe Calderon, whose term ends in 2012, defends his militarized approach to defeating drug cartels.
snippet: As his presidency enters its twilight, President Felipe Calderón of Mexico is striving to codify the militarized approach to combating drug cartels that has defined his tenure.
lead_paragraph: As his presidency enters its twilight, President Felipe Calderón of Mexico is striving to codify the militarized approach to combating drug cartels that has defined his tenure.

headline.main: Mexico’s President Works to Lock In Drug War Tactics
headline.print_headline: Mexican Leader Wants Drug War Set in Law
headline.seo: Calderón Defends Militarized Response to Mexico’s Drug War
